result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Intake Report- Marathon County Pretrial Services  - Completed 09-15-2022

9:57 a.m.
Clerk Micki.

Defendant fails to appear. 
Court notes a Notice of Appearance has been filed by Attorney Dan Cveykus.
Court denies appointment of Counsel.

Adj: 9:58 a.m.

Indigency hearing on September 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 15, 2022 at 08:50 am.
Preliminary Hearing on December 12, 2022 at 02:50 pm.
Final pre-trial on January 4, 2023 at 08:50 am.

No contact with victim(s): J.P. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (2) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
